Exaggerate: The claim exaggerates Dr. Fauci's statement by implying that he said there is no reason to wear a mask at all, when in reality he stated that there is no reason for people to be walking around with a mask.
Contradict fact: The claim contradicts the fact that since April, the CDC has recommended face coverings to prevent the spread of COVID-19 and Dr. Fauci has also pushed for their use.
Lack enough support: The claim lacks enough support as it only provides a short video clip without any additional context or evidence.
Problematic assumption: The claim makes the problematic assumption that Dr. Fauci's statement from four months ago is still relevant and applicable to the current situation.
Exist alternative explanation: The claim ignores the alternative explanation that Dr. Fauci's statement was made in the early stages of the pandemic when the understanding of the virus and its transmission was still evolving.
